title: Ericsson shares jump 6% as sales fall less than expected, North America returns to growth
content: Ericsson reported a smaller-than-expected 7% drop in second-quarter sales as sluggish demand for 5G gear was slightly offset by growth in North America.
summary: Ericsson reported a smaller-than-expected 7% drop in second-quarter sales as sluggish demand for 5G gear was slightly offset by growth in North America.

title: Biden loses his train of thought, calls Harris 'Vice President Trump' in solo press conference
content: President Biden has faced growing drop-out pressure from Democratic lawmakers, donors and from some voter polling after his debate flop against Donald Trump.
summary: President Biden has faced growing drop-out pressure from Democratic lawmakers, donors and from some voter polling after his debate flop against Donald Trump.

title: China gears up for next week's Third Plenum meeting. Here's why real estate isn't likely the main focus
content: China's real estate problems may be massive, but analysts expect the upcoming Third Plenum to focus on other areas — such as high local government debt levels.
summary: China's real estate problems may be massive, but analysts expect the upcoming Third Plenum to focus on other areas — such as high local government debt levels.

title: Europe markets reach 1-month high; Ericsson soars 8%
content: European stocks opened higher Friday, defying a broader global selloff, with fresh inflation data set to land.
summary: European stocks opened higher Friday, defying a broader global selloff, with fresh inflation data set to land.

title: China's imports unexpectedly drop in June, but exports beat forecasts
content: China's imports fell in June, missing expectations for slight growth, while exports grew more than expected, customs data released Friday showed.
summary: China's imports fell in June, missing expectations for slight growth, while exports grew more than expected, customs data released Friday showed.

title: Apple expands Vision Pro to more countries outside the U.S.
content: The Vision Pro will hit stores in Australia, Canada, France, Germany and the U.K. on Friday, following the headset's debut in Asian markets.
summary: The Vision Pro will hit stores in Australia, Canada, France, Germany and the U.K. on Friday, following the headset's debut in Asian markets.

title: Ambani's wedding kicks off in India this weekend. Here's who will be at the star-studded event

title: Global population to peak within this century as birth rates fall, United Nations report says
content: The world population is on course to peak earlier than expected this century and at a lower level, the United Nations forecasts.
summary: The world population is on course to peak earlier than expected this century and at a lower level, the United Nations forecasts.

title: Biden stumbles over Zelenskyy introduction, calls him 'President Putin'
content: The latest verbal gaffe by U.S. President Joe Biden comes as he faces increasing calls by Democrats to quit the 2024 election contest against Donald Trump.

title: As the Ambani wedding gets underway — here's why Indian nuptials are so big and glamorous

title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Modi in Moscow. What’s new?

title: Here are the world’s top 15 airports — for on-time flights
content: Some 86% of flights from major airports in Cape Town, Brasilia and Panama City are on time, according to a new report by AirHelp.
summary: Some 86% of flights from major airports in Cape Town, Brasilia and Panama City are on time, according to a new report by AirHelp.

title: Biden won't drop out of election against Trump unless polls say 'there's no way you can win'
content: President Joe Biden is still on track to face Donald Trump despite some Democrats wanting Vice President Kamala Harris to become their nominee.
summary: President Joe Biden is still on track to face Donald Trump despite some Democrats wanting Vice President Kamala Harris to become their nominee.

title: Samsung is developing AI features specifically for China as it looks to claw back into market
content: Samsung is developing its suite of artificial features known as Galaxy AI specifically for the Chinese market, the company's mobile chief TM Roh told CNBC.
summary: Samsung is developing its suite of artificial features known as Galaxy AI specifically for the Chinese market, the company's mobile chief TM Roh told CNBC.

title: Thursday was a historically strange day in the stock market. That may be good news
content: The Russell 2000 small-cap index jumped more than 3% on Thursday, but every one of the so-called "Magnificent Seven" stocks fell.
summary: The Russell 2000 small-cap index jumped more than 3% on Thursday, but every one of the so-called "Magnificent Seven" stocks fell.

title: Japan's yen surges after U.S. inflation data as traders monitor possible intervention
content: The dollar lost around 2% against the Japanese yen on Thursday as the market was suddenly jolted by fresh inflation U.S. data.
summary: The dollar lost around 2% against the Japanese yen on Thursday as the market was suddenly jolted by fresh inflation U.S. data.

title: U.S. cities are sinking. Here's what that means for homeowners
content: Home values in areas with high land subsidence could drop 8.1%, according to forthcoming research. It's not the only way sinking surfaces could affect consumers.
summary: Home values in areas with high land subsidence could drop 8.1%, according to forthcoming research. It's not the only way sinking surfaces could affect consumers.

title: CNBC Daily Open: S&P retreats, yen surges, Tesla sinks
content: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite retreated from record highs as investors pivoted away from Big Tech, like Nvidia and Meta Platforms.
summary: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite retreated from record highs as investors pivoted away from Big Tech, like Nvidia and Meta Platforms.

title: Delta says the Olympics will cost it $100 million as travelers skip Paris
content: Delta says travelers are opting for other destinations or booking outside of the dates of the Olympic Games.
summary: Delta says travelers are opting for other destinations or booking outside of the dates of the Olympic Games.

title: Japan is worried about another 'transactional' Trump presidency, Tokyo-based expert says
content: The Japanese government was "pretty certain that Biden had this well in hand." However, the ruling LDP is now reappraising the odds of a "Trump 2.0 presidency."
summary: The Japanese government was "pretty certain that Biden had this well in hand." However, the ruling LDP is now reappraising the odds of a "Trump 2.0 presidency."

title: JPMorgan is bullish on this Southeast Asian country, cites opportunities in data centers

title: Microsoft's decision to give up OpenAI board observer seat doesn't quell key concerns

title: Biden 'needs to drop out' campaign official says, more Democrats in Congress agree

title: Inflation falls 0.1% in June from prior month, helping case for lower rates
content: The monthly inflation rate dipped for the first time in more than four years, providing further cover for the Fed to start lowering rates later this year.
summary: The monthly inflation rate dipped for the first time in more than four years, providing further cover for the Fed to start lowering rates later this year.

title: Tesla shares close down 8% after report of robotaxi unveiling delay
content: Tesla is reportedly pushing back the unveiling of its self-driving taxi to October from August.
summary: Tesla is reportedly pushing back the unveiling of its self-driving taxi to October from August.

title: NATO condemns China as a 'decisive enabler' of Russia's war in Ukraine in most serious rebuke to date
content: NATO labeled Beijing a "decisive enabler" of Russia's war in Ukraine and expressed concern over Beijing's "systemic challenges" to the coalition's security.
summary: NATO labeled Beijing a "decisive enabler" of Russia's war in Ukraine and expressed concern over Beijing's "systemic challenges" to the coalition's security.

title: Britain's largest water utility placed under special measures as it grapples with $20 billion debt pile
content: Regulators gave Thames Water permission to raise customer bills by an average £99 annually over the next five years, nearly half of what it asked for.
summary: Regulators gave Thames Water permission to raise customer bills by an average £99 annually over the next five years, nearly half of what it asked for.

title: Apple reaches deal with EU regulators to open up mobile payments system to rivals
content: EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager said the European Commission accepted commitments from Apple to open access to its tap and go payments tech to rivals.
summary: EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager said the European Commission accepted commitments from Apple to open access to its tap and go payments tech to rivals.

title: Pfizer moves forward with once-daily version of weight loss pill after setbacks
content: The company plans to conduct studies in the second half of the year evaluating multiple doses of the drug.
summary: The company plans to conduct studies in the second half of the year evaluating multiple doses of the drug.

title: Jim Cramer explains how to trade Thursday's tech sell-off
content: After buyers fled from Big Tech on Thursday, CNBC's Jim Cramer advised investors to take advantage of the rotation but beware that it may not last long.
summary: After buyers fled from Big Tech on Thursday, CNBC's Jim Cramer advised investors to take advantage of the rotation but beware that it may not last long.
